definitions.definition: Used to refer to a specific item or items.
definitions.example: The cat sat on the mat.

examples: The book is on the table.

definitions.definition: Used when referring to something for the first time.
Used before a vowel sound when referring to something for the first time.
definitions.example: An apple fell from the tree.

definitions.definition: Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else.
definitions.example: The keys are in the drawer.

definitions.definition: Physically in contact with and supported by a surface.
definitions.example: The book is on the table.

definitions.definition: Expressing location or arrival in a particular place or position.
Indicating the means of achieving something or proximity to something.
definitions.example: The letter was sent by mail.

definitions.definition: Accompanied by or having something.
Expressing motion in the direction of a particular location.
Indicating the point in space or time at which something starts.
At a higher level or layer than something else.
definitions.example: The plane flew above the clouds.

definitions.definition: At a lower level or layer than something else.
definitions.example: The fish swim below the surface.

definitions.definition: Used to connect words or phrases.
Used to link alternatives.
definitions.example: I can go, or I can stay.

definitions.definition: Used to introduce something contrasting with what has been mentioned before.
Used to introduce a result or consequence.
definitions.example: It was raining, so we stayed inside.

examples: I was hungry, so I ate.

definitions.definition: At the time that.

examples: When it rains, I stay inside.
I was sleeping when the phone rang.

definitions.definition: Used to refer to a male person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified.
Used to refer to a female person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified.
Used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
Used to refer to the speaker and one or more other people.
definitions.example: We are going to the park.

definitions.definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced.
Third person singular present of 'be'.
Second person singular and plural, and first and third person plural present of 'be'.
First and third person singular past of 'be'.
Be able to.
Used to express the future tense or intention.
Used to make a word or group of words negative.
Used to emphasize an adjective or adverb.
To a higher degree than is desirable or possible.
Frequently; many times.
definitions.example: I often go to the gym.

definitions.definition: Of high quality or extent.
Of poor quality or low standard.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Of considerable size or extent.
Of a size that is less than normal or usual.
Having lived or existed for only a short time.
Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole or belonging.
Indicating the purpose, reason, or recipient of something.
On the subject of or concerning.
Directly below something or covered by it.
definitions.example: The cat is under the table.

definitions.definition: Extending directly above or across something.
definitions.example: The bridge goes over the river.

definitions.definition: In the space separating two points or objects.
Moving in one side and out the other of something.
At the side of or next to.
Close to in distance or time.
definitions.example: The shop is near the station.

definitions.definition: Located or situated on every side of.
From one side to the other of something.
In opposition to or in contact with.
In a line next to or following the length of.
Surrounded by or in the company of.
At the back of or after something.
definitions.example: The car is behind the house.

definitions.definition: Under or below something, often with a sense of being covered.
At or to the further side of something.
Without being affected by; in spite of.
Throughout the course or duration of.
Not including; other than.
Within the interior of something.
definitions.example: The keys are inside the box.

definitions.definition: On or to the outer side of something.
In the intervening period between a time and the present.
In the direction of.
Up to the point in time or the event mentioned.
On or immediately after.
Inside the range or limits of.
Not having or accompanied by.
Nevertheless; in spite of that.
Used to introduce a further negative statement.
definitions.example: I don’t like tea, nor do I like coffee.

definitions.definition: For the reason that.
In spite of the fact that.
Introducing a conditional clause.
During the time that.
Following the time when.
definitions.example: We left after it stopped raining.

definitions.definition: Earlier than the time when.
Except if.
definitions.example: I won’t go unless you come.

definitions.definition: In or to the place that.
Used to refer to the person or people being addressed.
Used by a speaker to refer to themselves.
Objective case of 'I', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Objective case of 'he', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Objective case of 'she', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Objective case of 'we', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Objective case of 'they', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Possessive form of 'I', indicating ownership.
Possessive form of 'you', indicating ownership.
Possessive form of 'he', indicating ownership.
Possessive form of 'they', indicating ownership.
Possessive form of 'it', indicating ownership.
Reflexive form of 'I', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'you', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'he', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'she', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'it', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'we', used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'you' (plural), used for emphasis or as an object.
Reflexive form of 'they', used for emphasis or as an object.
Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker.
Plural of 'this', used to identify specific things close at hand.
Plural of 'that', used to identify specific things farther away.
Used to refer to a person or people.
Objective form of 'who', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
Possessive form of 'who', indicating ownership.
Used to ask for information about something.
Used to specify one or more items from a set.
An unspecified amount or number of something.
One, some, or all, without specification.
Not any; no one.
The whole quantity or extent of something.
The two together.
Every one of two or more considered individually.
All the individual items in a group.
A small number of something.
A large number of something.
More than two but not many.
A single person or thing.
Any person at all.
Every person.
An unspecified person.
Not a single person.
Any thing, no matter what.
All things.
An unspecified thing.
Not anything; no single thing.
Second person singular and plural, and first and third person plural past of 'be'.
Exist or occur; base form of the verb 'to be'.
Past participle of 'be'.
Present participle of 'be', indicating existence or action in progress.
Possess, own, or hold.
Third person singular present of 'have'.
Past tense and past participle of 'have'.
Perform an action.
Third person singular present of 'do'.
Past tense of 'do'.
Past tense of 'can', indicating possibility or ability.
Expressing possibility or permission.
Expressing a smaller possibility.
Be obliged to; should.
Used to indicate future action, often formally.
Indicating obligation, duty, or correctness.
Past tense of 'will', indicating future in the past or conditional.
definitions.example: I would help if I could.

definitions.definition: In addition; too.
Only or exactly.
And no one or nothing more besides.
At all times; on all occasions.
At no time in the past or future.
Occasionally, rather than all the time.
Under normal conditions; generally.
Not often; seldom.
Not often; rarely.
At a fast speed.
At a slow speed.
In a good or satisfactory way.
In a bad or unsatisfactory way.
definitions.example: He did badly on the test.

definitions.definition: Without difficulty or effort.
With a great deal of effort.
After the expected or proper time.
Before the expected time.
In or after a short time.
Before now or before a specified time.
Up to and including the present time.
In, at, or to this place.
In, at, or to that place.
In all places.
In or to an unspecified place.
Not in or to any place.
Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
Having lived or existed for a long time.
Not existing before; recently made or acquired.
Measuring a great distance or duration.
Measuring a small distance or duration.
Of great or more than average height.
Having a high temperature.
Having a low temperature.
Moderately hot; comfortable temperature.
Moderately cold; pleasantly refreshing.
Giving out or reflecting much light; vivid.
With little or no light.
Having a lot of light or being pale in color.
Of great weight or intensity.
Moving or capable of moving at high speed.
Moving or operating at a low speed.
Making little or no noise.
Producing much noise.
Free from dirt or impurities.
Covered or marked with dirt.
Pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically.
Unpleasant or unattractive in appearance.
Having a lot of money or valuable possessions.
Lacking sufficient money or quality.
Having the power to move heavy weights or perform physically demanding tasks.
Lacking physical strength or energy.
In accordance with fact or reality.
Not according with truth or fact.
Correct or morally good.
Not correct or morally unacceptable.
Of great significance or value.
Known about by many people.
Not the same as another.
Identical; not different.
Coming immediately after the present one.
Most recent or final.
Coming before all others in time or order.
Coming after the first in time or order.
Coming after the second in time or order.
